page.title: 01Overview of block 04040279
page.content: This block is in the southern suburbs of Birmingham, 6km from the centre, not far from the boundary. Two radial roads cross it: Pershore Road connecting the city with{Kings Norton}and Alcester Rd. with{Kings Heath}. Mainly residential, the area's older houses date from the late 19th century, followed by inter- war semi detached and modern estates. Most distinctive are the houses of the {Bournville Trust} developed when {Cadbury's} chocolate factory was moved from the centre to a healthier environment. Cadbury's and the factory centre in {Kings Norton}are the only significant industrial sites. The northern part of the area is heavily built-up with some parks in {Kings Heath}and{Stirchley}. There is more open space and a lower housing density in{Bournville}and{Kings Norton}.
